intro: Eremurus kopet-daghensis, commonly known as the Kopet-Dag eremurus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Eremurus, which is part of the sunflower family, Asteraceae. This plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy yellow or greenish-yellow flower heads. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Eremurus kopet-daghensis is often found in desert and semi-desert environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
